summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) dated August 16, 2019, discussing outstanding investigative items related to the death of Jeffrey Epstein. It forwards a list of evidence and records requested from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) concerning Epstein's suicide, including computer history, video, count slips, employee banking info, and incident reports.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender/signer of the email, working in the Southern District of New York, coordinating the request for outstanding items from the BOP regarding Epstein's death.

events.title: Epstein's Death and Initial Investigation
events.description: The date referenced for specific count slips and surveillance logs related to the finding of Jeffrey Epstein's body in his cell.

events.title: Period of Interest for BOP Emails
events.description: Start date for requested BOP emails, covering the period through mid-August 2019, related to Epstein's incarceration and death.

keyFacts: The document is a request from SDNY prosecutors to the BOP for extensive evidence related to Jeffrey Epstein's death, indicating an active investigation into the circumstances.
Specific items requested include computer/internet history, video, count slips for August 9, 2019, banking information for all identified BOP employees, and Tru-scope logs for the SHU.
The request seeks to identify who wrote the BOP suicide timeline and the SHU roster for August 10, 2019, suggesting scrutiny of official accounts.
The email highlights the coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office, the FBI (for phone workup and credit checks), and the BOP's Office of the Inspector General (OIG).
